data.question: What are the two structures formed from the self-assembly of Ni(II) macrocyclic complex and 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylate?
data.answer: Molecular brick wall and molecular honeycomb

data.question: What causes the different molecular topologies in structures 1 and 2?
data.answer: The different coordination mode of BTC3- anion

data.question: Is the effective cavity size of structure 1 larger than that of structure 2?
What method was used for the X-ray diffraction measurements of structures 1 and 2?
What interaction is experienced by the pyridine guest in structure 2?
data.answer: π−π interaction with the benzene ring of BTC3-

data.question: Do both structures 1 and 2 exhibit weak anti-ferromagnetic interactions?
What is the role of hydroxyl pendants in the structures of 1 and 2?
data.answer: They act as hydrogen acceptors to form hydrogen bonds with secondary amines of the macrocycle in neighboring layers

data.question: What happens to the networks of structures 1 and 2 when immersed in water?
data.answer: They decompose into the building blocks

data.question: Are the supramolecular networks of 1 and 2 soluble in solvents other than water?
What is the effect of guest inclusion experiments on the framework rigidity of structure 1?
data.answer: The framework rigidity of structure 1 is evaluated by FT-IR spectra and elemental analysis, showing changes in crystallinity and water content with different solvents

data.question: What is the publication year of the research article discussing the self-assembly of molecular brick wall and molecular honeycomb structures?
Does the heating of structures 1 and 2 at 120 °C for 2 hours result in the loss of all guest molecules?
What is the significance of the π−π interaction in structure 2?
data.answer: It induces the symmetrical binding mode of BTC3- in structure 2

data.question: Are the crystalline samples of structures 1 and 2 stable upon exposure to the atmosphere?
What analytical techniques were used to characterize the synthesized structures?
data.answer: Infrared spectra, elemental analyses, UV/vis diffuse reflectance spectra, magnetic susceptibility measurements, thermogravimetric analysis (TGA), differential thermal analysis (DTA), and X-ray powder diffraction

data.question: What is the role of the square-planar Ni(II) macrocyclic complex in the self-assembly process?
data.answer: It acts as a metal building block for constructing the multidimensional networks

data.question: Can the networks of structures 1 and 2 maintain their three-dimensional frameworks after removal of the included guests?
What is the impact of guest molecules on the assembly of the host structures?
data.answer: The host structures assembled are greatly affected by the guests, even by a partial change of the guests

data.question: What is the crystal system of structures 1 and 2?
What is the significance of the research on the self-assembly of molecular brick wall and molecular honeycomb structures?
data.answer: It demonstrates the use of S = 0 Ni(II) macrocyclic complex as a metal building block in constructing multidimensional networks and shows how host structures are affected by guests
